abstract: Exelon, the largest U.S. operator of nuclear plants, became the third major utility to cancel its membership in the Chamber of Commerce because of differences over climate policies.
snippet: Exelon, the largest U.S. operator of nuclear plants, became the third major utility to cancel its membership in the Chamber of Commerce because of differences over climate policies.
lead_paragraph: Exelon, one of the country’s largest utilities, said Monday that it would quit the United States Chamber of Commerce because of that group’s stance on climate change. It was the latest in a string of companies to do so, perhaps a harbinger of how intense the fight over global warming legislation could become.

headline.main: Climate Bill Splits Exelon and U.S. Chamber
headline.print_headline: Climate Bill Splits Exelon And Chamber Of Commerce

byline.original: By Clifford Krauss and Kate Galbraith
